Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 10:31AM caligal wrote: My onc said that I should stay away from litterbox duties, so the bf is doing that along with the food  & water.  They also recommended washing your hands before and after you touch your pets and I was told no kissing my pets until 3 days after treatment.  I am done with chemo right now and I don't think that applies to herceptin but I will see doc on monday and find out.  The kisses was the hardest part.  I even told my cat no kisses and he looked at me like, but why?  Kind of funny.
Posts.Title: pets and chemo haykat57 mittmott

Posts.Content: caligal wrote: Yo, started ac on nov 12, should be done with that the end of this year, then 12 weeks of taxol/herceptin (herceptin continues for a year) rads somewhere in there.  Shaved head last week cuz my hair was coming out after I took a shower.  Little cold here in MI, haven't gotten a wig yet, still considering whether or not I want to. Just wearing the winter hats, do rags and baseball caps. anyone else have a similar schedule?  Mel  Dx 9/18/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: looking for chemo sisters who started nov 07 caligal sue_blue

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2008 09:59PM caligal wrote: I wish my hair would grow faster I wish for a cure I wish no one would ever hear its cancer I wish everyone has a great boyfriend like mine I wish my life would go back to what it was before all this I wish the govt would help more with cancer payments I wish I could play hockey this year I wish everyone has great docs/oncs/techs like I have I wish peace to everyone on this board
